Material used.Description: Ion channel activity was measured using α-synuclein variants reconstituted in lipid bilayers.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Altered ion channel conductance and voltage response
Readout description.Result Description: E46K mutant exhibited increased ion channel formation compared to wild-type. GM3 reduced channel activity, while GM1 had no effect.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Lipid bilayers without α-synuclein were used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Baseline ion channel activity (wild-type) with no significant changes in conductance or voltage response.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in conductance or voltage response compared to wild-type.

Material used.Description: Lipid bilayer reconstitution was performed using GM3, GM1, and standard phospholipids.

Readout description.Result Description: GM3 reduced the ion channel activity of E46K mutant, while GM1 had no effect.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Basic positive control.Description: Phospholipid bilayers without gangliosides were used as a baseline.

Basic negative control.Description: Lipid bilayers with no α-synuclein were used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Baseline lipid bilayer stability with no significant changes in ion channel activity.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant changes in lipid bilayer stability or ion channel activity.
